intro: Psychotria capacifolia, commonly known as the "Cape Cod psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a waxy texture. Psychotria capacifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
